discoveries.finding: ATI (Animate Trajectory Inference) model has been largely forgotten despite being powerful
discoveries.details: ATI is described as a 'sick model' that just needed better UI implementation

discoveries.finding: RIFE can run in real-time when coded properly
discoveries.details: Fill's implementation is 10x faster than other developers' versions by coding it properly

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 was not trained with CLIP vision at all
discoveries.details: Using CLIP vision with Wan 2.2 is just bloat on workflow and VRAM with no benefit

discoveries.finding: FlashVSR can upscale single images when used with multiple steps
discoveries.details: 1 step, then 4 steps, then 8 steps produces sharper upscaled images. Takes 2 seconds per step after initial loading

discoveries.finding: Wan models can do basic latent noise mask based inpainting without VACE
discoveries.details: Any Wan model does basic inpainting quite well, questioning the need for WanAnimate and VACE for some tasks

discoveries.finding: Grid noise pattern was present in initial Wan models
discoveries.details: Bad grid noise pattern existed in early model versions but was fixed in later releases

discoveries.finding: Noise masking works well for Wan models like image models
discoveries.details: Basic noise masking techniques from image generation are effective with Wan video models

discoveries.finding: VACE inpainting is more consistent than basic approaches
discoveries.details: VACE provides better consistency for inpainting tasks compared to standard methods

discoveries.finding: SVI-film reduces artifacting for extensions with 5 input frames
discoveries.details: SVI-film LoRA specifically designed to reduce artifacts when extending videos using exactly 5 input frames

discoveries.finding: Latent noise mask works for both i2v and t2v models
discoveries.details: Because it's not based on the i2v channels, latent noise masking is effective for both image-to-video and text-to-video models

discoveries.finding: Clearing Triton cache can dramatically reduce VRAM usage
discoveries.details: User saw VRAM usage drop from 14.3GB to 8.7GB after clearing Triton cache and updating dependencies

discoveries.finding: Most video models are trained at 16fps which struggles with fast motion
discoveries.details: Training at 16fps or similar framerates creates inherent limitations for capturing fast motion accurately

discoveries.finding: Wan Animate control input is very flexible
discoveries.details: Can accept various types of input beyond just standard ControlNet inputs like depth/pose - more of a 'guide' than a 'pin' like ATI

discoveries.finding: ATI gives trajectory control for character animation
discoveries.details: Better for subtle animations like breathing and swaying compared to standard Wan 2.2 I2V

discoveries.finding: UniC3 works with Wan 2.2 at higher strength
discoveries.details: Need to use strength of at least 3, tested up to 4-5 for effect with 2.2 models

discoveries.finding: Dynamic/resized LoRAs cause OOM with torch compile
discoveries.details: LoRAs with different ranks within cause massive recompiles and memory issues when torch compile is enabled

discoveries.finding: Wan Animate can follow point trajectories for animation control
discoveries.details: Works well for guiding objects along paths, not just for dances as commonly assumed. Better quality than ATI but doesn't 'pin' items like ATI

discoveries.finding: Wan Animate can work with first-to-last frame control
discoveries.details: Can use character on first and last frame, but ref input with background without character. When character moved, got correct text from ref image

discoveries.finding: BindWeave model released
discoveries.details: Wan 2.1 I2V based subject-consistent video generation with cross-modal integration using MLLM. Only 2 new layers, text projection to use Qwen VL 7B outputs

discoveries.finding: Video-as-prompt feature working
discoveries.details: Finally fixed logic error where self attention output layers weren't applied on corresponding output. Works with cfg now, tested with Wan 2.1 I2V

discoveries.finding: SageAttention 2.2 significantly faster
discoveries.details: Generation speed way faster for t2v Wan after installing sage attn 2.2 with torch 2.10.0

discoveries.finding: VAP (Video Alignment Protocol) doesn't work properly
discoveries.details: Testing shows VAP outputs are just from the prompt, with placebo effect. Even their own code doesn't work in any useful manner. Any difference from reference video doesn't actually matter what video you use

discoveries.finding: BindWeaver model uses unusual input structure
discoveries.details: Uses 4 references encoded separately in latents, concatenated to front of I2V channel. Empty references are still used as zeros: [ref_0, ref_1, ref_2, ref_3] [start_image + padding]. Start image becomes 5th latent

discoveries.finding: Holocine maximum frame count is 375 frames
discoveries.details: Exceeding 375 frames causes system crash. 403 frames also tested and works

discoveries.finding: WanFirstLastFrameToVideo node exists for native start/end frame I2V
discoveries.details: Built-in node for Wan 2.2 first-last frame workflow instead of using custom inputs

discoveries.finding: Cinematic Hard Cut v2 LoRA can create transitions between scenes
discoveries.details: Works by creating hard cuts between different scenes when combined with Qwen edit for second scene generation

discoveries.finding: BindWeave model uses image alpha channel as I2V channel mask
discoveries.details: The model expects alpha channel for masking but dataset images don't have alpha channel

discoveries.finding: BindWeave background should be BLACK for best results
discoveries.details: Model appears to want black background for proper generation

discoveries.finding: QwenVL input image needs specific resizing logic
discoveries.details: If width*height > 720*1280 resize to 0.3 scale, else 0.75 scale. Arbitrary but improves results

discoveries.finding: Clip vision resolution is only 224x224
discoveries.details: Very small resolution means if using full reference image with small face, it can be detrimental

discoveries.finding: Q8_0 vs bf16 casted to fp16 shows 0 difference in quality
discoveries.details: Testing showed no visible quality difference between these formats

discoveries.finding: Lightx2v v1030 appears cleaner than v1022
discoveries.details: User reports better results with newer version after testing

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 I2V has better identity preservation than LTX2 Pro
discoveries.details: LTX2 Pro has some of the worst identity preservation in an I2V model despite high video quality output, while Wan 2.5 is phenomenal at identity preservation

discoveries.finding: Position matters when using multiple references in Bindweave
discoveries.details: The positioning and arrangement of multiple reference images affects the output quality in multi-reference Bindweave generations

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 first-last frame performs better than Veo 3
discoveries.details: Veo 3 first-last frame just fades out the first image instead of proper interpolation, while Wan does proper first-last frame morphing

discoveries.finding: Bindweave supports objects as subjects, not just people
discoveries.details: The model can handle object-based subject consistency in addition to human subjects

discoveries.finding: Bindweave works without clip or qwenVL conditioning
discoveries.details: Generated smooth 121 frames at 480p without any text or vision conditioning, producing interesting morphing effects

discoveries.finding: Bindweave model is trained from Wan 2.1 I2V 720p
discoveries.details: Confirmed by Kijai that Bindweave is 720p and trained from 2.1 I2V, not 2.2

discoveries.finding: QwenVL in Bindweave has minimal effect
discoveries.details: Kijai reports the QwenVL part has minimal to no effect, works without it, unsure how to use it properly

discoveries.finding: Bindweave uses specific negative prompt
discoveries.details: Uses comprehensive negative prompt: 'Bright tones, overexposed, static, blurred details, subtitles, style, works, paintings, images, static, overall gray, worst quality, low quality, JPEG compression residue, ugly, incomplete, extra fingers, poorly drawn hands, poorly drawn faces, deformed, disfigured, misshapen limbs, fused fingers, still picture, messy background, three legs, many people in the background, walking backwards, split screen, divided frame, frame split, multiple parts, separated,motionless, frozen, still image, no movement, stationary, unmoving'

discoveries.finding: Bindweave ref_masks should be white on image, black on padding
discoveries.details: Box mask for subject is important as full frame mask makes it all washed out

discoveries.finding: New T2V Seko v2.0 LightX2V uses 'Phased DMD' distillation method
discoveries.details: The newer LightX2V version uses 'Phased DMD' technique instead of self-forcing

discoveries.finding: SeC-4B provides tighter masking than Sam2
discoveries.details: SeC-4B masking is alot tighter than Sam2 with blockify expand

discoveries.finding: EdgeTAM is much faster than Sam2
discoveries.details: EdgeTAM is 7 months old, light version of Sam2, faster but slightly less accurate. 15fps on phone reportedly

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 low-noise model works as excellent refiner
discoveries.details: Can be used to refine any T2I model output with denoise value 0.2, works even with SD1.5

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 can handle in-between frames
discoveries.details: Model can process sequences with frames between start and end, not just first-to-last frame

discoveries.finding: PainterI2V node enhances LightX2V LoRA dynamics
discoveries.details: Manipulates motion by pre-scaling input latents and balancing brightness increase

discoveries.finding: Flash VSR 1.1 is significantly better than v1
discoveries.details: Smoother and more natural looking results, less VRAM hungry

discoveries.finding: Multitalk works with silent audio for idle animations
discoveries.details: Using silence audio makes body and head move like speaking videos but mouth won't move

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 masks are inverted from VACE
discoveries.details: blank image = black mask, opposite of VACE behavior

discoveries.finding: Single frames inserted in middle of sequences are ignored
discoveries.details: Only sequences of 2+ frames have effect, single frames get blended with prev/next frames

discoveries.finding: svi-film lora only works with hn model at high strength
discoveries.details: Need strength set to 3, doesn't fix distorted frames but prevents color shifting

discoveries.finding: Frames within 4+1 block appear blended together
discoveries.details: Each frame appears to be a bit blended with the prev/next frame, causing light flashes and dark compensation

discoveries.finding: Painter node adds input image to gray frames in I2V
discoveries.details: Uses coded formula: diff = gray_latent - start_latent, then scales with motion_amplitude

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 I2V handles noisy input images well
discoveries.details: Can handle 0.2 augment noise in input image effectively

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 can do multi-keyframe natively
discoveries.details: Set frames you want to the last frame of a latent (latent indices are 4x+1)

discoveries.finding: CUDA 130 is faster than 128 without compile
discoveries.details: CUDA 130 roughly as fast as torch compile was on 128, but torch compile on 130 produces black/static images

discoveries.finding: injecting some noise helps a lot with video generation
discoveries.details: Using noise injection in the generation process improves results

discoveries.finding: Wan Animate can use ATI trajectories with first frame and ref
discoveries.details: Model can handle trajectories from ATI along with first frame and reference image inputs

discoveries.finding: Setting VACE white level from gray (0.5) to black (0) fixes awful end frames
discoveries.details: Changing the VACE white level from gray (mid 0.5) to 0 (black) eliminates noise at the end of generations

discoveries.finding: Wan Animate supports multiple control inputs simultaneously
discoveries.details: Can use first frame, last frame, one ref slot, controlnet, and trajectories all together

discoveries.finding: Audio CFG of 8.0 fixes gibberish output in Ovi model
discoveries.details: Bumping audio_cfg to 8.0 resolved mostly gibberish output and made Ovi work properly

discoveries.finding: For wrapper implementations the 'null' image is black, for native it's gray
discoveries.details: Different implementations use different null image colors - wrapper uses black frames, native uses gray frames

discoveries.finding: Audio negative prompt connection bug discovered and fixed
discoveries.details: Node was storing negative as positive and expecting it to be negative when it was positive, so audio negative was never actually used

discoveries.finding: Default video negative is 253 tokens, short video negative is 11 tokens
discoveries.details: Log shows torch.Size([253, 4096]) vs torch.Size([11, 4096])

discoveries.finding: EasyCache can skip significant steps while maintaining quality
discoveries.details: Skipped 16 out of 50 steps in one test, 9 out of 40 in another

discoveries.finding: Motion augmentation scheduling creates interesting effects
discoveries.details: Can schedule which latent frames motion is applied to, creating scene transition effects

discoveries.finding: Bindweave model on HuggingFace is missing the scaled_fp8 key for ComfyUI native
discoveries.details: This prevents it from loading properly in native ComfyUI

discoveries.finding: OVI 1.1 works better with specific resolutions
discoveries.details: Works well with horizontal formats like 1280x704, 960x512, 1120x448. Vertical formats like 512x960 don't work as well

discoveries.finding: OVI 1.1 needs more swap blocks to avoid OOM
discoveries.details: Requires 25-30 swap blocks for 1280x704 resolution on 24GB VRAM

discoveries.finding: Context windows don't work well with I2V models
discoveries.details: Each context window is its own model call needing input image, but you only have single clean input for whole process

discoveries.finding: Kandinsky 5 Pro 20B model parameters confirmed
discoveries.details: It's around 20B parameters and considering how the 2B performs, it could be about 2x-4x better than Wan2.2

discoveries.finding: Generated latent artifacts explained
discoveries.details: It's triggered by the mismatch between real (encoded) and generated latents. Generated latents are usually blurry, decoder doesn't know how to handle blurry latents as they're out of distribution, so it generates speckle/grid artifacts as its failure mode

discoveries.finding: VRAM cleanup nodes don't work with node-cached models
discoveries.details: If the node references to the model, it's cached in the node itself and it can not be freed. VRAM clean nodes generally do not do anything

discoveries.finding: LightX2V LoRA effectiveness patterns
discoveries.details: Earlier LightX loras were still better than new ones in light testing. Both are better than the initial lightning ones

discoveries.finding: Ovi 1.1 resolution preferences confirmed
discoveries.details: 1280x704 and 704x1280 working best, low you go get bad quality shake and wrong motion

discoveries.finding: Kandinsky 5.0 2B model significantly outperforms Wan 2.2 5B and 2.1 14B
discoveries.details: Ada reports that Kandinsky 2B blows away 2.2 5B and 2.1 14B in quality

discoveries.finding: Kandinsky 20B T2V works with FP8 and blockswapping
discoveries.details: Ada successfully got 20B T2V working with FP8 quantization and block swapping on 24GB VRAM

discoveries.finding: Kandinsky 20B has uncensored NSFW capability
discoveries.details: 20B fully knows nudity with no barbie doll censoring on top or bottom

discoveries.finding: Face detailer workflow can improve small faces in generated videos
discoveries.details: Running a face detailer workflow afterwards makes a big difference for videos with small faces

discoveries.finding: Closer framing helps with face likeness in Wan Animate
discoveries.details: Using closer framing in reference images improves results

discoveries.finding: spacepxl is making progress on training a better VAE to fix speckle/dithering
discoveries.details: Working on Wan VAE training to fix the speckle/dithering problem, though GAN component is holding back quality

discoveries.finding: TTM (Time to Move) technique is masked latent inpainting with timestep scheduling
discoveries.details: The method is fundamentally masked latent inpainting with timestep scheduling, possibly implementable with native ComfyUI nodes

discoveries.finding: TTM works with any model, not just Wan
discoveries.details: The technique should work with any video generation model, tested with Wan 1.3B T2V

discoveries.finding: LightX2V causes ghosting issues on low noise side
discoveries.details: Using LightX2V LoRA on the low noise part of split samplers creates ghost artifacts and ruins video quality

discoveries.finding: TTM provides camera control capabilities for I2V models
discoveries.details: TTM enables camera control effects like zoom and movement for Wan 2.2 I2V that can't be achieved with prompts alone

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 high/low noise split makes motion techniques work better
discoveries.details: The MoE architecture's high/low noise expert split allows for better motion control and resolution

discoveries.finding: TimeToMove (TTM) is essentially just v2v + differential diffusion with the right masks
discoveries.details: TTM isn't really a new technique, just works well with Wan 2.2. The original code applies it only for a few steps (3-7 out of 50 total steps)

discoveries.finding: TTM works by understanding direction and path from reference video automatically
discoveries.details: The model can follow paths and directions from reference footage without needing specific prompts for movement direction

discoveries.finding: LightX2V LoRA v1030 performs very close to base model motion quality
discoveries.details: New lightx2v lora is very impressive for i2v, much better than other lightx2v variants or lightning. Works well when adjusting shift value to match sigma boundary at 0.900

discoveries.finding: MoGe2 works well for generating 3D models for camera animation with TTM
discoveries.details: Can generate 3D model and set up in Blender in under 2 minutes. Just import model, plug texture into emission shader, place camera at 0,0,0 and adjust focal length

discoveries.finding: TTM can be used as vid2vid where you define different noise to the masked area
discoveries.details: TTM is essentially vid2vid with noise applied to masked regions

discoveries.finding: Mask can be one frame and acts like v2v
discoveries.details: Setting mask to one black frame makes TTM behave like vid2vid

discoveries.finding: LightX2V is problematic for low noise part in TTM
discoveries.details: LightX2V works fine for high noise but causes issues in low noise sampling, huge quality gap when removed

discoveries.finding: LightX2V 1030 is I2V model
discoveries.details: 1030 version is specifically for I2V, not T2V distill

discoveries.finding: SAM3 uses prompt-based segmentation
discoveries.details: More precise prompts give more accurate segmentation, can limit to 1 simultaneous segmentation, automatically retrieves highest confidence mask

discoveries.finding: TTM fixes lighting and object interactions
discoveries.details: TTM fixes lighting of animated objects to match scene and animates hair/clothes interactions

discoveries.finding: WAN is 16fps native, requires prompting adjustments for 24fps
discoveries.details: When converting 16fps WAN output to 24fps, need to prompt for slow motion to achieve normal speed playback

discoveries.finding: FFGO LoRA enables multiple subject generation with Wan 2.2 I2V
discoveries.details: Uses specific trigger prompt 'ad23r2 the camera view suddenly changes.' and requires white background for reference subjects

discoveries.finding: res_2s and multistep samplers effectively do twice the steps
discoveries.details: For fair comparison, should compare res_2s at X steps vs other samplers at 2X steps

discoveries.finding: FFGO works with multiple characters (3-4 subjects tested)
discoveries.details: Even number of references may work better, very sensitive to prompting

discoveries.finding: FFGO can work as IP adapter with single image
discoveries.details: FFGO transfers style and colors well even with just one image, working like an IP adapter

discoveries.finding: Holocine + FFGO makes I2V work
discoveries.details: Combining Holocine and FFGO enables image-to-video functionality

discoveries.finding: TTM and FFGO can be combined
discoveries.details: TTM (Time-To-Move) can be combined with FFGO for enhanced control

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 shows significant visual improvement over 2.1
discoveries.details: Comparison described as 'like rtx on and off', with 2.2 having realism and global illumination-like lighting

discoveries.finding: FFGO trigger prompt requirement
discoveries.details: Need to add trigger prompt 'ad23r2 the camera view suddenly changes.' to the start when using FFGO

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 has MoE architecture with High/Low noise expert split
discoveries.details: First the High noise model handles noise over a certain threshold, then the Low model finishes the generation

discoveries.finding: v2v with base wan i2v 2.2 models can use reference without FFGO or TTM
discoveries.details: Reference frames can be inserted and work exactly like VACE. Characters can come from out of frame and maintain likeness. Used 0.8 denoise with 8 steps.

discoveries.finding: First frame in TTM doesn't need to be actual first frame of video
discoveries.details: Can use any frame as reference to help preserve environment and character consistency, even if it doesn't match the motion sequence chronologically

discoveries.finding: Native TTM node values are different from wrapper version
discoveries.details: Set start step in sampler, TTM node steps are on top of that. Example: 4 steps sampler + 2 steps TTM

discoveries.finding: FL13 created working tiled upscaler for wan i2v
discoveries.details: Doesn't limit to VRAM if you set few number of tiles. Can upscale to 2K/4K but very slow (10+ minutes for 2K on 4090)

discoveries.finding: Can do v2v without TTM by encoding motion video and plugging into latent input
discoveries.details: Set denoise to 0.7-0.8, enable 'add_noise_to_samples' on first sampler only

discoveries.finding: Reference frames work by inserting reference 4 times then starting image
discoveries.details: Must fit the 4-frame block rule, reference becomes part of the video like a hard cut edit

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 uses two models split by timestep range
discoveries.details: High noise trained on sigma >= 0.875, low noise on low timesteps. Like MoE but experts are entire models selected by timestep

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 low noise is probably a 2.1 finetune
discoveries.details: High noise is more different from 2.1. Splitting allows each to perform better on their part of the schedule

discoveries.finding: Modern models use flow matching and predict velocity (noise - data)
discoveries.details: ComfyUI converts to x0 prediction. Flow matching outperforms diffusion across the board

discoveries.finding: RF schedule focuses lots on high noise then tails off
discoveries.details: 'Shift' parameter controls the curvature of the inference schedule

discoveries.finding: Wan masks are inverted between wrapper and native implementations
discoveries.details: Masks work differently between wrapper/native versions - they are inverted

discoveries.finding: Frame windows are fixed in Wan Animate causing hallucination after input ends
discoveries.details: X(frame window) - (x-1)(motion frames) = total frames - this causes Wan to continue generating after input clip finishes

discoveries.finding: Native Wan Animate V2 is better than V1
discoveries.details: V1 underperforms for native, V2 version is a fix for native implementation

discoveries.finding: You can feed RGB video directly as control input without preprocessor
discoveries.details: You technically don't need to use a controlnet preprocessor, you can input a video directly as a control - it should follow the structure and motion

discoveries.finding: HY1.5 empty latent speeds up Wan T2V generation
discoveries.details: Using HY1.5 empty latent on Wan makes T2V very fast and is very good for upscaling

discoveries.finding: Triton caches cause memory increases after updates
discoveries.details: Any model code change can end up having to recompile during inference, adding on top of current VRAM use, mostly on Windows

discoveries.finding: fp16 models can be faster than fp8_scaled on Ampere cards
discoveries.details: Full fp16 versions of Wan 2.2 run as fast or faster than fp8_scaled on RTX 3090/3090 Ti due to how Ampere handles fp16

discoveries.finding: ComfyUI can load models larger than GPU VRAM
discoveries.details: Can load full fp16 models that exceed VRAM capacity by swapping, performance depends on RAM speed and motherboard

discoveries.finding: Depth maps work better than masks for selective upscaling
discoveries.details: Using clipped depthmap stops upscaler adding unnecessary detail in background, more accurate than regular masking

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 high and low noise models run sequentially
discoveries.details: Since they don't run simultaneously, you could potentially use larger models for each stage

discoveries.finding: LoRA stacking prevents fading issues
discoveries.details: Can stack MOE high noise, Lightx2v 480p rank 256, and Wan 2.1 LoRAs without fading, unlike using MOE alone

discoveries.finding: SteadyDancer preprocessing might work with other models
discoveries.details: All preprocessing (pose detector, pose alignment) is applied before blocks, so might be compatible with other models beyond the base 2.1 I2V

discoveries.finding: SVDQuant uses nunchaku implementation with custom kernels for speed
discoveries.details: Has int8 and fp8 matmuls plus torch compile, but no actual int4 matmuls despite claims

discoveries.finding: SteadyDancer uses positive and negative pose inputs
discoveries.details: Negative pose appears to be mis-aligned version used as negative conditioning, with scale differences between positive and negative

discoveries.finding: SteadyDancer uses triple model passes by default
discoveries.details: 50 steps x 3 passes = 150 total model calls, vs 4 steps shown in testing

discoveries.finding: JSON prompting works for video models without specific training
discoveries.details: Structured JSON format provides more precise directions than loose text prompts, works with Wan models

discoveries.finding: Denoise parameter works differently in wrapper vs native
discoveries.details: WanVideoWrapper denoise is just step adjustment shortcut, while native KSampler does actual denoise calculations

discoveries.finding: SteadyDancer requires base model weights
discoveries.details: Pose embeddings are only 6MB, but LoRA extraction failed because patch embed was trained too

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 5B model is significantly undertrained
discoveries.details: The diffusion model can't handle the VAE properly, despite the VAE itself not being that bad. Shows worse structure/motion than 1.3B

discoveries.finding: 1.3B model performs better when trained on high res with control inputs
discoveries.details: Unless you train it on high resolution with control inputs, then it's actually really strong

discoveries.finding: CFG distillation is the primary driver of step distillation
discoveries.details: Theory from Z-Image research that cfg distillation actually drives step distillation performance

discoveries.finding: Latent upscaling requires diffusion models for proper results
discoveries.details: Best way to latent upscale is with a diffusion model trained as control lora to take low res latent and output high res latent. Interpolating latents is a fool's game without generative models

discoveries.finding: Kandinsky 5.0 Pro shows near Veo3 quality
discoveries.details: Near Veo3 quality for motion and semantics, about wan2.1 level for prompt following. Even 2B outperforms Wan2.1 in motion and semantics

discoveries.finding: SeedVR can be better than other options sometimes
discoveries.details: Although one step really isn't enough, can show grainy artifacts

discoveries.finding: Phantom works amazingly well for replicating subjects like product photos
discoveries.details: Demonstrated excellent subject replication capabilities in product photo scenarios

discoveries.finding: Using separate student loras for high/low noise in distillation
discoveries.details: Concept for DMD distillation: 14B teacher, 1.3B student, 1.3B fake, with separate student loras for high/low noise

discoveries.finding: Custom ops can prevent graph breaks in torch.compile while keeping parts uncompiled
discoveries.details: Using @torch.library.custom_op allows uncompiled operations like sageattention and unmerged lora application to be part of the graph without breaking it, preventing memory issues

discoveries.finding: Graph breaks cause 4-5GB higher peak VRAM usage
discoveries.details: Intermediate tensors like q, k, v do not get released and stay in VRAM until whole block is done when graph breaks occur

discoveries.finding: SageAttention holds unnecessary fp16 q and k tensors
discoveries.details: Latest version holds input fp16 q and k for no reason above the int8 that it actually uses, could drop at least 1GB of peak VRAM by fixing this

discoveries.finding: Context windows work with concat latent controls
discoveries.details: Native context windows PR now works with concat latent controls, context window blends are almost invisible especially with freenoise enabled

discoveries.finding: New optimizations dramatically reduced memory usage
discoveries.details: RAM usage dropped from 110GB to 80GB, GPU shared memory from 63GB to 34GB, VRAM to 10GB on test case

troubleshooting.problem: FlashVSR dtype error with Float and Half mismatch
troubleshooting.solution: Roll back to version checkpoint commit 9e0b3afe4eef5188ac441e83e06edd7ed2b26150

troubleshooting.problem: OOM issues with Wan Animate on 5090 that previously worked
troubleshooting.solution: Enable LoRA merging in LoRA load node to fix memory issues

troubleshooting.problem: Silent crash with native torch compile
troubleshooting.solution: Remove --pinned-memory and --async-offload flags, especially if at RAM limit

troubleshooting.problem: VAP model doesn't work with CFG
troubleshooting.solution: Implementation still has issues, not fully working yet

troubleshooting.problem: Higher VRAM usage with low resolution I2V than high resolution
troubleshooting.solution: Issue acknowledged but no solution provided

troubleshooting.problem: Newer wrapper version causes OOM errors
troubleshooting.solution: Roll back to earlier version or increase blockswap settings. Also try clearing Triton cache

troubleshooting.problem: SVI-Shot gives frozen frame video with Wan 2.2
troubleshooting.solution: SVI-Shot doesn't work with 2.2 at all, need to use alternative approaches

troubleshooting.problem: Input frames get glitchy with ghosting in clip extension
troubleshooting.solution: Replace glitched frames with original frames if ghosting doesn't affect rest of clip

troubleshooting.problem: VRAM usage increased after wrapper update
troubleshooting.solution: Update all dependencies, clear Triton cache, update wrapper, clear Triton cache again

troubleshooting.problem: Custom sigma and step mismatch with Euler scheduler
troubleshooting.solution: Other schedulers work fine, issue specific to Euler with 2.2 HN sampler

troubleshooting.problem: Massive VRAM increase with torch compile
troubleshooting.solution: Consider dropping torch compile attempts or use --cache-none argument

troubleshooting.problem: Second sampler uses much more VRAM/RAM than first
troubleshooting.solution: Use --cache-none argument or save latent to disk between samplers

troubleshooting.problem: First compile run uses significantly more VRAM on Windows
troubleshooting.solution: Clear Triton caches, sometimes just running workflow again works

troubleshooting.problem: OOM issues with dynamic LoRAs and torch compile
troubleshooting.solution: Add @torch.compiler.disable() to apply_lora function in custom_linear.py and clear triton cache

troubleshooting.problem: Old VACE workflows suddenly not working
troubleshooting.solution: Remove custom nodes that hook into sampler, search .py files for wrapper conflicts

troubleshooting.problem: Wan Animate causing image shake without masking
troubleshooting.solution: Use masking and expand mask in y-axis using transform node to reduce overall shot wiggles

troubleshooting.problem: Memory issues after ComfyUI update
troubleshooting.solution: Roll back to commit from Oct 12-13th to resolve memory problems introduced around Oct 15th

troubleshooting.problem: Triton cache causing issues
troubleshooting.solution: Clear triton cache folder, can be found at C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\Temp\torchinductor_username or ~/.triton on Linux

troubleshooting.problem: RuntimeError: stack expects a non-empty TensorList in Diffusion Forcing
troubleshooting.solution: No specific solution provided yet

troubleshooting.problem: Longcat dropping reference image
troubleshooting.solution: Set attention_mode to sdpa in model loader

troubleshooting.problem: Float and BFloat16 dtype mismatch in Longcat
troubleshooting.solution: Revert wrapper version to 1.3.6 or turn off compile

troubleshooting.problem: OOM issues after git pull
troubleshooting.solution: Add --cache-none to launch script, or disable --fast command line argument

troubleshooting.problem: Torch compile bug causing VRAM spikes
troubleshooting.solution: Cancel and rerun to get normal memory use, or disable dynamic LoRAs for full graph compilation

troubleshooting.problem: Sage 1 compatibility issues
troubleshooting.solution: Upgrade to SageAttention 2.2: pip install --upgrade sageattention --force-reinstall

troubleshooting.problem: vae.encode None type error
troubleshooting.solution: VAE is somehow NoneType - check VAE loading

troubleshooting.problem: Sage attention broke after ComfyUI update due to rope commit
troubleshooting.solution: Update KJNodes - Kijai fixed it using core attention override system instead of monkey patching

troubleshooting.problem: Input type FloatTensor and weight type CUDABFloat16Type mismatch with bf16 wan animate
troubleshooting.solution: Cannot merge loras with low mem load enabled for wan animate

troubleshooting.problem: Context options with reference latent causes device mismatch error
troubleshooting.solution: Remove reference latent to avoid 'tensors on cuda:0 vs cpu' error

troubleshooting.problem: Qwen not compatible with ComfyUI core controlnet node
troubleshooting.solution: Bypass controlnet node - error disappears when removed

troubleshooting.problem: Wan animate doesn't work without lightx loras - overexposed at higher CFG
troubleshooting.solution: Ask in wan comfyui channel for specific settings

troubleshooting.problem: Holocine BindWeaver model requires enabling merge loras
troubleshooting.solution: Enable merge loras and set image dimensions to multiple of 16

troubleshooting.problem: RuntimeError: The size of tensor a (29124) must match the size of tensor b (24)
troubleshooting.solution: Remove KJnodes folder and git clone again, works with Sage Attention and latest comfyui

troubleshooting.problem: CUDA out of memory after ComfyUI update
troubleshooting.solution: Use --disabled-pinned-memory flag or rollback ComfyUI commit

troubleshooting.problem: System freeze on Image Concatenate Multi
troubleshooting.solution: Add 'unload all models' toggle at end of workflow

troubleshooting.problem: End frame becomes discolored/purple with jpg artifacts
troubleshooting.solution: Enable fun_or_fl2v_model setting for anything but basic 2.1 I2V

troubleshooting.problem: Interpolation fails with torch.cuda.HalfTensor vs torch.cuda.FloatTensor mismatch
troubleshooting.solution: Issue occurs after resize image node, still being investigated

troubleshooting.problem: High VRAM usage with lower resolutions using specific LoRAs
troubleshooting.solution: Use --reserve-vram 2 flag when starting ComfyUI

troubleshooting.problem: FlashVSR node output causing errors with other nodes
troubleshooting.solution: Add .cpu().float() to the final node output: return(output.cpu().float() ,)

troubleshooting.problem: Multiple WanWrapper installs causing image_embeds error
troubleshooting.solution: Remove duplicate WanWrapper installations, ensure only one is active

troubleshooting.problem: FlashVSR memory leak with tile sizes above 256
troubleshooting.solution: Use tile size 256 or below - 288 and higher cause memory leaks

troubleshooting.problem: CUDA error appearing randomly in ComfyUI
troubleshooting.solution: Try the flag --disable-pinned-memory if using latest ComfyUI

troubleshooting.problem: Wan Animate has visible shift/transition in video
troubleshooting.solution: Adjust mask to be tighter around subject, leave thin edge on top so model sees what's there, try 50% coverage on problematic areas

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI memory leak with color match node
troubleshooting.solution: Disable pinned memory with --disable-pinned-memory flag, remove --fast and --async-offload

troubleshooting.problem: Bindweave QwenVL input errors
troubleshooting.solution: Recreate the node to fix old input name from workflow

troubleshooting.problem: LongCat loading extremely slow on CPU
troubleshooting.solution: Use GPU instead of CPU for text encoding nodes, CPU loading is much slower

troubleshooting.problem: NAG (Negative Conditioning) no longer works with updated Bindweave
troubleshooting.solution: Known issue after update, but results are much better without it

troubleshooting.problem: Contrast shifting at exact same point in every video
troubleshooting.solution: Switch from Tiled VAE Decoding to regular VAE Decoding

troubleshooting.problem: Custom 2.1 style LoRAs won't work with LongCat
troubleshooting.solution: LongCat is not a Wan model, just similar structure - nothing trained for Wan will work

troubleshooting.problem: Memory leak issues with ComfyUI
troubleshooting.solution: Try --disable-pinned-memory flag or --cache-none, disable multi-gpu node pack

troubleshooting.problem: Green color appearing on buildings in Wa20 Motion Control
troubleshooting.solution: No definitive solution provided, issue persists across different samplers/schedulers

troubleshooting.problem: SeC Model loader errors
troubleshooting.solution: No solution provided in discussion

troubleshooting.problem: WanAnimate goes black screen with clip embeds and sageattn on some GPUs
troubleshooting.solution: Disconnect clip output or use PatchSageAttentionKJ node with sageattn_qk_int8_pv_fp16_cuda mode

troubleshooting.problem: Torch compile + scaled models + pinned memory causes instant OOM
troubleshooting.solution: Use GGUF models instead of fp8_scaled for torch compile compatibility

troubleshooting.problem: VAE decode OOM on 24GB VRAM
troubleshooting.solution: Use unload all models and vramdebug before decode

troubleshooting.problem: Memory leak in FlashVSR node with non-256 tile sizes
troubleshooting.solution: Use alternative node from https://github.com/1038lab/ComfyUI-FlashVSR which doesn't have memory leak

troubleshooting.problem: Torch compile issues with VRAM
troubleshooting.solution: Clear Triton cache at C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\Temp\torchinductor_<username>

troubleshooting.problem: Green artifacts when using higher resolution (720p)
troubleshooting.solution: The noise becomes too fine at higher resolutions, causing green artifacts. Model seems to generate noise based on color distribution proportion of background video

troubleshooting.problem: CUDA out of memory after ComfyUI and Python dependencies update
troubleshooting.solution: Use --disable-pinned-memory command line argument or update ComfyUI-GGUF custom node and switch to UnetLoaderGGUFDisTorch2MultiGPU

troubleshooting.problem: Triton compilation error with ATI workflow
troubleshooting.solution: Disable torch compile or sageattention - it's a Triton installation issue not related to the workflow

troubleshooting.problem: Bidirectional sampling causes instant OOM
troubleshooting.solution: Can do 1000 frames but not 512 with bidirectional due to enormous VRAM increase

troubleshooting.problem: Ovi model producing mushy/blurry results
troubleshooting.solution: Remove the extra audio model node and only use the video model, or increase audio_cfg to 8.0

troubleshooting.problem: Audio issues with multi-channel video files
troubleshooting.solution: Video had separate speech channels - extract as mono/stereo or save as stereo 44.1kHz

troubleshooting.problem: WanVideoUniAnimateDWPoseDetector error 'cannot convert float NaN to integer'
troubleshooting.solution: Occurs when hand detection fails, likely didn't detect the hand properly

troubleshooting.problem: Audio quality issues in Ovi model
troubleshooting.solution: Connect text_embeds instead of negative_text_embeds, or use proper negative prompt configuration after bug fix

troubleshooting.problem: Bindweave produces noise/scribbling output on native ComfyUI
troubleshooting.solution: Cannot work properly on native - needs wrapper implementation with proper QwenVL integration and noise padding

troubleshooting.problem: Updated wan wrapper causing OOM with Ditto
troubleshooting.solution: No specific solution provided yet

troubleshooting.problem: Device mismatch error with ref latent on context options
troubleshooting.solution: Issue is with having RMBG or SAM models on CPU - not fixed yet

troubleshooting.problem: OVI 1.1 OOMing on 24GB VRAM
troubleshooting.solution: Use 40 swap blocks instead of 30-36

troubleshooting.problem: SAM2 segmentation causing OOM after processing
troubleshooting.solution: Use first frame only for LLM/VLM, let SAM handle rest based on it

troubleshooting.problem: OVI audio text spilling outside <S> <E> tags
troubleshooting.solution: Make sure text inside tags is long enough (around 10 seconds worth)

troubleshooting.problem: Poor Wan Animate LoRA results
troubleshooting.solution: Use trigger word in captions, train on 720p images with videos, use lower rank (32 instead of 64)

troubleshooting.problem: OOM on loops with Sa2VA segmentation
troubleshooting.solution: Edit the node's code to force unload the Qwen model after each run with a bool setting

troubleshooting.problem: Garbled and discolored first/last frames with new lightx2v lora
troubleshooting.solution: Reduce the shift to 5, as dpm_sde highlights these details more

troubleshooting.problem: Kandinsky 5 VAE OOM issues
troubleshooting.solution: Use tiled VAE or it will OOM. Also torch version related - works on 2.7.1 but not 2.9

troubleshooting.problem: Comfy UI slowdown in browser
troubleshooting.solution: Opening comfy in chrome on mac doesn't have this problem. On same machine where it's slow in chrome, works fine in firefox

troubleshooting.problem: High VRAM usage setting
troubleshooting.solution: Set to normal VRAM instead of high VRAM to reduce memory issues

troubleshooting.problem: Plastic waxy look in renders
troubleshooting.solution: 20 steps is way too much when using lightx LoRA, try 4-6 steps. Also CFG should be 1 on both samplers

troubleshooting.problem: Tiled VAE causes temporal blending artifacts at frame 45 with Wan 2.2
troubleshooting.solution: Better to run lower resolution with default VAE than higher resolution with Tiled VAE

troubleshooting.problem: Fixed seed doesn't prevent animation changes when adjusting other settings
troubleshooting.solution: Any change to size, shift, or other parameters will change the output regardless of fixed seed - this is normal behavior

troubleshooting.problem: Wan Animate keeps too many facial features from input video instead of reference image
troubleshooting.solution: Disconnect the face_images input from WanVideo Animate Embeds node

troubleshooting.problem: OOM issues that have been popping up more frequently
troubleshooting.solution: Add --disable-pinned-memory to launch .bat and remove --fast parameter

troubleshooting.problem: Ovi 1.1 unclear speech quality
troubleshooting.solution: Update to latest nightly nodes and try using higher audio cfg (up to 10)

troubleshooting.problem: Ghost artifacts appearing in TTM videos
troubleshooting.solution: Remove LightX2V LoRA from low noise sampler - only use it on high noise side

troubleshooting.problem: TTM doesn't work with split samplers initially
troubleshooting.solution: Apply TTM only on high noise side, not low noise side, as it shouldn't be applied to low noise anyway

troubleshooting.problem: Latent burn and mask seams with VACE Fun
troubleshooting.solution: Still being investigated, no clear solution provided yet

troubleshooting.problem: IndexError with 5B model
troubleshooting.solution: Increase sample count - error occurs when samples are too low

troubleshooting.problem: TTM mask quality issues
troubleshooting.solution: Need perfect alpha channel without background cuts - use separate background and person/item rather than inpainting

troubleshooting.problem: DMP++_SDE sampler causing issues with second sampler in dual sampling
troubleshooting.solution: Stop the reference one step before the last step of high noise to fix the issue

troubleshooting.problem: TTM fails if empty space has no noise or content
troubleshooting.solution: Make sure background areas have some content, TTM doesn't work well with fully black/empty backgrounds

troubleshooting.problem: Double character issue appearing in generations
troubleshooting.solution: Remove subject from reference image, or check if using distill LoRA at too high strength (someone was accidentally using 2.2 lora at 3.0 strength)

troubleshooting.problem: Resolution mismatch errors when changing default settings
troubleshooting.solution: Make sure resolution settings match between nodes when modifying from defaults

troubleshooting.problem: WanVideoEncode error: GET was unable to find an engine to execute this computation
troubleshooting.solution: Change WanVideo VAE Loader from bf16 to fp16

troubleshooting.problem: Module errors when using VACE with wrong model combinations
troubleshooting.solution: Use T2V models with VACE node, I2V models give errors saying VACE only works with T2V

troubleshooting.problem: TTM dimension mismatch with 5B model
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure dimensions are divisible by 32 as 5B requires, check for 720 vs 704 pixel issues

troubleshooting.problem: TTM mask code assumes 2.1 latent space with 5B model
troubleshooting.solution: Kijai fixed the mask creation for 5B VAE compatibility

troubleshooting.problem: Attention_mode=sageattn causes corrupted output on H100
troubleshooting.solution: Switch back to SDPA attention mode

troubleshooting.problem: LoRA key not loaded messages
troubleshooting.solution: Clear the caches, often caused by using wrong model/lora combinations like 2.1 I2V lora on non-2.1 model

troubleshooting.problem: Transformers 4.57.1 causing errors with Wan I2V
troubleshooting.solution: Error was actually from too long prompt, not transformers version

troubleshooting.problem: TTM animation leaving white spaces when moving objects
troubleshooting.solution: Use outpainting or clone tool to fill the cutout space with background content

troubleshooting.problem: OOM issues after triton update
troubleshooting.solution: Add --disable-pinned-memory to launch script and remove --fast launch argument

troubleshooting.problem: Low VRAM usage with 8GB
troubleshooting.solution: Use --cache-none argument with fast drive and enable Windows virtual memory

troubleshooting.problem: Character cheeks interpreted as sad lips in Wan Animate
troubleshooting.solution: User seeking solution for correcting facial expression interpretation

troubleshooting.problem: FFGO scene switching at inconsistent frames
troubleshooting.solution: Potentially add mask to last reference frame to guide the model

troubleshooting.problem: TTM ghosting issues
troubleshooting.solution: Shift start and end values on TTM node, mix with playing with shift value on sampler. Sometimes obvious in high noise preview showing double characters.

troubleshooting.problem: TypeError: WanTimeTextImageEmbedding.forward() got an unexpected keyword argument 'timestep_seq_len'
troubleshooting.solution: Need to update to compatible workflow/model versions

troubleshooting.problem: Silent fatal crashes in ComfyUI
troubleshooting.solution: Usually RAM related. Try disabling pinned memory and/or increasing OS swap size

troubleshooting.problem: OOM issues with Wan 2.2 Mocha
troubleshooting.solution: Can swap up to 40 blocks. Text encoder memory is separate from sampling. Try lower resolution like 448x256 instead of 480p

troubleshooting.problem: Loop nodes causing memory leaks
troubleshooting.solution: Suspected memory leak in easy-use looping nodes, doesn't clear RAM properly

troubleshooting.problem: ValueError when using T2V model with encoded images
troubleshooting.solution: T2V models only work with text prompts, I2V models needed for encoded images

troubleshooting.problem: Reference frames being denoised even with masks
troubleshooting.solution: Masks seem to be ignored in this setup, may need different approach

troubleshooting.problem: FFGO reference image takes part of output video
troubleshooting.solution: Use node to ignore first 4 frames, or cut with video editor. Trim latent node may work

troubleshooting.problem: RuntimeError about channel mismatch (36 vs 68 channels)
troubleshooting.solution: Switch from 2.2 VAE to 2.1 VAE - 2.2 models use 2.1 VAE

troubleshooting.problem: InfiniteTalk hanging at 720p/1280 width
troubleshooting.solution: Stick to lower resolutions like 640p square, 720p may be too demanding

troubleshooting.problem: Dithering dots in Wan 2.2 output
troubleshooting.solution: Use more steps instead of recommended LightX2V steps

troubleshooting.problem: Green/pink color tint with T2V-A14B controlnet
troubleshooting.solution: Switch to different LightX LoRA, may be incompatibility between old LoRAs and new models

troubleshooting.problem: Wan video preview not showing in sampler node after update
troubleshooting.solution: Check if preview is enabled in settings - updates can turn it off

troubleshooting.problem: Pink hue/color shifts in Wan output
troubleshooting.solution: Enable add_noise_to_samples on the first sampler

troubleshooting.problem: Wan going OOM after a few generations
troubleshooting.solution: Known recurring issue, no definitive fix mentioned

troubleshooting.problem: Pose detection failing on 2D drawings/sketches
troubleshooting.solution: Try using SAM3D to convert drawings to more recognizable 3D figures first, then extract poses

troubleshooting.problem: Unable to subgraph nodes with Get/Set connections
troubleshooting.solution: Copy/paste the group of nodes to a new canvas, subgraph there, then copy back

troubleshooting.problem: High memory consumption after Wan wrapper updates
troubleshooting.solution: Clear triton caches and run model few times to get rid of recompilation overhead

troubleshooting.problem: Asian eyes appearing squinted/closed in Wan Animate
troubleshooting.solution: Disconnect background and mask so only pose and face inputs are used, background comes from reference image

troubleshooting.problem: Wan 2.2 Animate converting anime style to realistic
troubleshooting.solution: Disable lightx2v wan 2.1 lora and add 'anime, animation, 3d' to prompt to reduce realistic results

troubleshooting.problem: Context window size mismatch in native i2v
troubleshooting.solution: Don't leave context length at 81 when increasing latent count for frames above that - causes size mismatch

troubleshooting.problem: Slow VAE encoding on pytorch 2.9 vs 2.7
troubleshooting.solution: PyTorch version-dependent issue, rolling back to 2.7.1 cu128 showed significant speed improvements

troubleshooting.problem: Expected tensors on same device error with fp16
troubleshooting.solution: Don't place FreeMemory nodes right after loader and before sage attention - causes CPU/CUDA device mismatch

troubleshooting.problem: Flashing artifacts in Wan 2.2 i2v generations
troubleshooting.solution: Issue was caused by overly long auto-generated prompts from Grok - making prompts more concise fixed the problem

troubleshooting.problem: KJ WanVideoSampler showing different results than KSampler
troubleshooting.solution: Use SamplerCustom with same sigmas list, or KSamplerAdvanced with matching start_at step, due to different denoise implementations

troubleshooting.problem: WanVideoSampler showing 7 steps and 85 frames for 81 frame video
troubleshooting.solution: 0.75 denoise_strength starts at later step than 0, and 85 frames includes reference frame processing

troubleshooting.problem: TTM high pass looks good in preview but low pass ignores it
troubleshooting.solution: Low pass gets more influenced by driving video, resulting in stiff choppy generation

troubleshooting.problem: Torch.compile causing massive VRAM usage and slow performance after updates
troubleshooting.solution: Clear Triton caches by deleting contents of C:\Users\<username>\.triton and C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\Temp\torchinductor_<username>, update triton-windows, restart ComfyUI

troubleshooting.problem: WanVideoWrapper showing recompile warnings and slow generation
troubleshooting.solution: Delete and reinstall WanVideoWrapper folder, check torch version compatibility, clear Triton caches

troubleshooting.problem: Context windows causing weird blending issues in long videos
troubleshooting.solution: Use cache none for long videos, though this isn't a complete fix

troubleshooting.problem: OOM errors with torch.compile on 720p 81 frames
troubleshooting.solution: Use chunked rope and pytorch RMS norm instead of compile, increase block swap to 40, set prefetch_blocks to 1 for better VRAM efficiency

troubleshooting.problem: Canny control making images look flat/2D
troubleshooting.solution: Need good prompting, use Fun Vace 2.2 which has improved control training, don't rely on reference input for style transfer

troubleshooting.problem: Skeleton+depth mix producing actual skeleton in output
troubleshooting.solution: Don't use skeleton+depth mix, send depth and skeleton into separate Vace control inputs using separate WanVaceToVideo nodes or WanVacePhantomDualV2 node

troubleshooting.problem: Graph breaks preventing tensor release in torch.compile
troubleshooting.solution: Use torch custom ops instead of @torch.compiler.disable() to avoid graph breaks while keeping parts uncompiled

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI memory management estimation errors
troubleshooting.solution: Use Manager's 'Unload Models' function or Purge VRAM node before suspected problem steps

troubleshooting.problem: Memory issues with Wan 2.2
troubleshooting.solution: Run with --reserve-vram flag, new wrapper optimizations should fix most issues

comparisons.verdict: Chrono Edit is worse than Qwen Edit
dasiwaWAN22 has better realism than SmoothMix
VACE isn't nearly as accurate with trajectories as ATI
FlashVSR looks oversharpened with halos compared to other upscalers

comparisons.comparison: Quantized vs FP16 models for consecutive frames
comparisons.verdict: Quantized models have certain chance of producing errors in consecutive frames, FP16 more reliable
Higher resolution produces better results but generation time increases threefold
VACE doesn't have glitchy input frame issues that SVI-film has, but SVI-film still helps reduce color shifting

comparisons.comparison: Wan 2.2 fp8 high vs low model generation time
comparisons.verdict: High model takes twice as long as low model for same user, unusual behavior
ATI gives trajectory control for specific animations, Wan 2.2 is general text/image to video - different use cases
FlashVSR better quality, SeedVR2 better but takes more time
Sora costs $0.1 per second, open models need to be cheaper or better to compete
Wan Animate better quality but ATI still wins for specific controls like face tracking and precise spinning motions
VACE has stronger native control, but Wan Animate saves time by keeping everything in same model
SmoothMix model still better than BindWeave for I2V
Full models are slightly stronger but you can't control strength, so LoRAs are preferred

comparisons.comparison: Prompting with '|' vs Cinematic Hard Cut LoRA
comparisons.verdict: LoRA actually works better than simple prompting methods like 'description before | description after'

comparisons.comparison: LTX 2 Pro vs other models in benchmarks
comparisons.verdict: LTX 2 Pro ranks 3rd in I2V (Wan2.5 at 13th), 7th in T2V (Wan2.5 at 14th). LTX 2 pro above Sora 2 pro overall

comparisons.comparison: Holocine general consensus vs demo quality
comparisons.verdict: General consensus is it isn't great compared to demo results
Same quality as Wan2.1 but new autoregressive architecture, 8B model from ByteDance
v1030 appears cleaner and better overall, v1022 adds less motion
Q5_K_M shows some differences (like extra eyebrows) but doesn't completely garbage output
Q8 is fast, but lower quants are slower to dequantize, avoid low quants

comparisons.comparison: Wan 2.2 I2V vs LTX2 Pro I2V
comparisons.verdict: Wan 2.2 has much better identity preservation, LTX2 Pro has poor identity preservation despite high video quality
Wan 2.2 does proper first-last interpolation while Veo 3 just fades images
MagRef only does single reference at full res, Phantom doesn't work well with distill LoRAs and breaks identity, Bindweave supports multiple references
Tiny seems 30% faster than full with near zero loss of quality
Area performs comparably to Lanczos but runs on GPU making it 10-20x faster
LongCat has limitations: requires multiple samplers instead of one, different architecture means LoRAs don't work and unlikely community will retrain, making it limited use case
Still very bad with anime content

comparisons.comparison: New T2V Seko v2.0 quality vs 250928
comparisons.verdict: Quality seems utter ass compared to the 250928 version
EdgeTAM is faster but slightly less accurate than Sam2

comparisons.comparison: Bindweave results before and after update
comparisons.verdict: Much better results after update, even though NAG no longer works

comparisons.comparison: I2V Wan vs VACE for start/end image handling
comparisons.verdict: I2V Wan treats start/end images as separate videos instead of blending, VACE blends them
2.1 VACE performs better than Fun 2.2 for most tasks, though Fun VACE better for some specific tasks
Built-in tiled processing better than cutting into separate chunks for longer videos

comparisons.comparison: WanAnimate quality with vs without svi-shot
comparisons.verdict: Quality degraded significantly when using svi-shot on wan animate

comparisons.comparison: Bindweave vs VACE for ID preservation
comparisons.verdict: Bindweave seems to get more similarity from what I've seen
It's just the fact that it's only 1.3B model that limits the quality so much, and low res too

comparisons.comparison: FastWan vs Turbo LoRA for speed
comparisons.verdict: FastWan is much better than Turbo LoRA for audio models

comparisons.comparison: HuMO vs InfiniteTalk for lip sync
comparisons.verdict: HuMO better for lip sync and expressiveness but same expression throughout, InfiniteTalk better all-rounder for longer videos and multiple characters
5B with Ovi is quite good, for 14B it would be close to Wan 2.5 quality
LongCat prompt adherence is closer to Wan 2.1, not as good as 2.2. Only better at video extension. No substitute for 2.2 A14B high noise for motion and prompting

comparisons.comparison: Training on T2V vs I2V models
comparisons.verdict: T2V designed to generate all visuals vs I2V focused on using image as starting point, so T2V has more image data to build on
2.2 is better in terms of fine details than 2.1
Really close to wan2.2. Just that prompt adherence is iffy. Else semantics, quality are really good
Earlier LightX loras were still better, both are better than initial lightning ones
3 ksampler merging is better than loop
2B blows away Wan 2.2 5B and 2.1 14B in quality
DA3 has worse image quality for monocular depth, more geometrically accurate but not good for Wan use

comparisons.comparison: Tiled VAE vs Default VAE for Wan 2.2
comparisons.verdict: Lower resolution with default VAE is better than higher resolution with Tiled VAE due to temporal artifacts
Question raised but not answered in this discussion

comparisons.comparison: TTM vs Uni3C for camera control
comparisons.verdict: TTM is described as 'the new uni3c for camera control in wan 2.2 i2v'
I2V works better for keeping background/subject consistent, T2V acts more like vid2vid
1.3B can't do real-time generation due to frame batching requirements, but causal models with 9 frames can be real-time

comparisons.comparison: LightX2V v1030 vs base model vs other speed LoRAs
comparisons.verdict: New lightx2v v1030 performs very close to base model motion, much better than other lightx2v variants or lightning LoRAs
Hunyuan creates actual 3D meshes (not point clouds) and looks better for objects, but VGGT still better for camera guidance in some cases
UniPC mostly just reduces small jitter while maintaining motion, while DMP++_SDE can cause issues with second sampler
SAM3 semantic segmentation not as good as SAM2 points-to-mask accuracy
3 sampler setup still worth it for motion testing

comparisons.comparison: With vs without LightX2V on low noise
comparisons.verdict: Huge quality gap, much better without LightX2V for low noise part
FFGO with Wan 2.2 beats Bindweave, Kijai feels sorry for Bindweave since 2.2 + LoRA basically replaces it
Bindweave allows full resolution per subject but can't match 2.2's motion capability

comparisons.comparison: Sec4B vs SAM2/3 for video segmentation
comparisons.verdict: Sec4B still preferred for video segmentation, though SAM2/3 have interactive features
2.2 has better realism and lighting, described as 'rtx on vs off'
Wan still appears better, though HunyuanVideo is 24fps and faster. Community consensus favors Wan quality

comparisons.comparison: Wan 2.2 Fun Vace + pose vs Wan Animate
comparisons.verdict: Wan 2.2 Fun Vace with pose might outperform Wan Animate for character animation
2.1 gives more intense motion for superhero action but animates background more. 2.2 gets movement but less intensity.
3 sampler method is best you can get compared to full 20 steps
T2V version more detailed but suffers on original details. I2V retains start image details even with high denoise
TTM more convenient and works well with anything thrown at it, but direct v2v approach also works

comparisons.comparison: I2V vs T2V for reference keeping
comparisons.verdict: I2V models keep reference while T2V models don't - makes sense
Flow matching outperforms diffusion pretty much across the board
Same idea but Wan 2.2 executed much better - nobody used SDXL refiner
WanAnimate doesn't understand depth at all, VACE 2.2 does
Should be as good as normal version but faster, though some find results look artificial
Quality is 1:1 or really close between wrapper and native implementations
Wan 2.2 is way better quality wise than 2.1

comparisons.comparison: Stable Audio vs ACE for video sound
comparisons.verdict: Both are not that good for generating sound for videos

comparisons.comparison: Anisora vs base Wan 2.2 for i2v
comparisons.verdict: Anisora works well for anime style movement with less artifacts and motion blur, but dramatically changes character appearances and colors - not suitable for animation tool use cases

comparisons.comparison: fp16 vs fp8_scaled on Ampere cards
comparisons.verdict: fp16 is as fast or faster than fp8_scaled on RTX 3090/3090 Ti, while fp8 models on non-fp8 cards just cast to fp16 anyway with extra compute overhead
PainterLongVideo is 'vibecoded nothing' - simple extension from last frame gives same results, while Painter I2V actually prepares latents in interesting way
480p rank 256 holds likeness and prompt adherence with less degradation than MOE alone, rank 256 gives more freedom but costs more parameters and possible artifacts vs rank 64
Unfair comparison since SteadyDancer doesn't do face at all, WanAnimate comparison is silly
UniAnimate works with other models and isn't much worse, if at all

comparisons.comparison: VACE vs I2V models for reference keeping
comparisons.verdict: I2V models have VACE beat for keeping reference identity

comparisons.comparison: Structured JSON vs natural language prompting
comparisons.verdict: JSON may help but natural language sometimes works just as well, no convincing evidence of major difference
Poor quality due to tiny attention windows preventing proper motion tracking, details swim around
1.3B shows better structure/motion despite being smaller, 5B is way undertrained
Kandinsky near Veo3 quality for motion/semantics, Wan2.1 level prompt following. Even 2B Kandinsky outperforms Wan2.1 motion
Z-Image turning out to be the most interesting recent model development
Fun Vace 2.2 has improved training for working with controls, especially openpose
Compile uses much more VRAM (18GB vs 11GB) on Windows with marginal speed benefits, not worth it

comparisons.comparison: del vs detach for memory management
comparisons.verdict: del is enough for inference mode, detach is about computation graph not memory
Graph break is worse than recompile, recompiles are fine if they aren't too many
Most use SeedVR2 or FlashVSR these days for video upscaling
Context window blends almost invisible, Starlight actually has horrible context seam in test clip

tips.tip: Describe foreground characters in HuMo prompts to avoid unwanted additions
tips.context: When doing lip-sync or character consistency work

tips.tip: Use static camera descriptions in prompts to prevent camera movement
tips.context: When generating with HuMo for lip-sync work

tips.tip: Try SVI-shot using first frame as reference to lock character in place
tips.context: For better character consistency in HuMo generations

tips.tip: Put trigger words in Chinese, rest of prompt in English for Qwen LoRAs
tips.context: When using Qwen Edit LoRAs with Chinese triggers

tips.tip: Use pressure cache to help with RAM usage for large models
tips.context: When running at RAM limits with native implementations

tips.tip: Prompting is incredibly important for all Wan models
tips.context: You often can't get away from iterating on prompting, no LLM one-shot solution known

tips.tip: Use noise masking for spatial inpainting to refine and detail
tips.context: Works great for refining and detailing in spatial inpainting tasks

tips.tip: Clear Triton cache after bigger updates
tips.context: Can be helpful for resolving VRAM and performance issues

tips.tip: Generate smaller and upscale rather than generating large
tips.context: Often gives better results than generating directly at high resolution

tips.tip: Don't use many LoRAs unmerged in general
tips.context: Better to merge LoRAs for better performance

tips.tip: Use high VRAM for better Wan Animate quality
tips.context: 96GB VRAM produces good results without post-processing

tips.tip: Set TRITON_CACHE_DIR to ComfyUI path
tips.context: Prevents cache interference between multiple ComfyUI installations

tips.tip: Remove Patch Model Patcher Order node
tips.context: Unnecessary with v2 compile nodes and can cause OOM

tips.tip: Use preview nodes on all outputs
tips.context: To understand exactly which frames you're getting from complex workflows

tips.tip: Lines work better than dots for Wan Animate control
tips.context: When creating control inputs for animation

tips.tip: Solid shapes work quite well for Wan Animate
tips.context: Alternative to lines for control inputs

tips.tip: Better character positioning helps reduce shake
tips.context: Position character close to first frame pose to reduce random shake in reference

tips.tip: Generate at higher resolution like 1920x1080
tips.context: May help with face problems in Wan Animate

tips.tip: Use MPS LoRA at 1.0 strength in high model
tips.context: Improves prompt adherence, marginally better than HPS

tips.tip: Use SmoothMix model with MPS LoRA
tips.context: Best way to use Wan I2V found so far

tips.tip: For models that don't like odd shots/angles, cut step count way down and use higher order sampler
tips.context: When trying to get unusual outputs like hybrid creatures or odd camera angles

tips.tip: Turn noise down or off (eta = 0.0) for better prompt adherence
tips.context: Higher noise levels help convergence toward more likely model outputs

tips.tip: Use 17 motion frames instead of 16 for smoother continuation
tips.context: 17 frames continue without hitching compared to 16 frames

tips.tip: Storyboard prompts for Holocine must be written concisely and clearly
tips.context: For better results with Holocine T2V generation

tips.tip: Set n frames higher than input n frames for first-to-last frame workflows
tips.context: When using first and last frame generation methods

tips.tip: Use face crop for clip vision instead of full image
tips.context: When face is small in reference image, full image can be detrimental

tips.tip: Disconnect clip vision from Wan Animate encode node for better likeness
tips.context: Especially helps as video progresses and after first window

tips.tip: Treat Wan Animate input image like VACE v2v start frame
tips.context: Make mask large enough to incorporate new character

tips.tip: Use Q8 quants with offloading instead of lower quants
tips.context: Only use lower quants if RAM limited, offloading is very fast now

tips.tip: Iterate prompts manually for better results
tips.context: Model may be capable but needs right prompt, don't assume it can't do something after few tries

tips.tip: Use Simple or Beta schedulers with lightx loras and low step counts
tips.context: These schedulers work better for prompt adherence with this setup

tips.tip: Use lower size images for Qwen and add box masks to padded reference images
tips.context: When using Bindweave with multiple references

tips.tip: Remove background for better subject freedom in Bindweave
tips.context: To avoid zoom out effects and get better character consistency

tips.tip: Use x4 upscale then downscale instead of direct x2 upscale
tips.context: For better quality with FlashVSR - x2 direct produces artifacts

tips.tip: Clear triton cache on Linux for better VRAM management
tips.context: Can reduce max allocated memory from 15.8GB to 9.9GB

tips.tip: Use box mask for subject in Bindweave
tips.context: Full frame mask makes results washed out

tips.tip: Pad references properly for Shot/Dance/Talk LoRAs
tips.context: Use custom mask to mask them out, this is how the LoRAs handle degradation

tips.tip: Use standard prompts for QwenVL in Bindweave
tips.context: Same prompt for both T5 and Qwen, not instructional system prompts

tips.tip: Always use CPU for text encoding
tips.context: General recommendation for resource management

tips.tip: Use Grounded SAM for text-to-mask tasks
tips.context: Most reliable for text to mask conversion

tips.tip: Use Florence2 to mask out characters for Multitalk
tips.context: For multi-character talking videos

tips.tip: Use audio without vocals for non-speaking character movement
tips.context: When you want character to move but not speak

tips.tip: Use median blur before Flash VSR to reduce sharpness
tips.context: Flash VSR can be too sharp for video

tips.tip: Use high strength for svi-film lora
tips.context: When using with hn model, set strength to 3 for visible effect

tips.tip: Different gray values in Painter node create different motion
tips.context: Values above 0.5 make result brighter, can adjust motion amplitude

tips.tip: For I2V prompts should avoid specific subject names/gender
tips.context: Makes prompt work better across different input images

tips.tip: Use VACE 2.1 with 2.2 models
tips.context: Can rename 2.1 to 2.2 and use VACE, or use VACE 2.1 model + 2.2 low

tips.tip: LightX2V significantly speeds up WanAnimate
tips.context: Without LightX, WanAnimate takes 40+ minutes; with LightX, 11 minutes for 8 steps

tips.tip: Use 4x latent + 1 rule for multi-keyframe approach
tips.context: When placing intermediate keyframes in video generation

tips.tip: Use black frames for wrapper, gray for native implementations
tips.context: When using null images in different Wan implementations

tips.tip: Masks are inverted between wrapper and native implementations
tips.context: When converting workflows between implementations

tips.tip: Remove negative prompt from audio model for cleaner audio
tips.context: When using Ovi model - connect text_embed instead of negative_text_embeds for better audio quality

tips.tip: Use short video negative prompt for better audio quality
tips.context: When using Ovi model with audio generation

tips.tip: CFG scheduling still helps with new LightX2V LoRA
tips.context: Use scheduled CFG on first step, sometimes second step for high motion cases

tips.tip: Do lipsync separately for best results
tips.context: Better to vid2vid with InfiniteTalk rather than trying to do everything in one pass

tips.tip: Use GIMP or Photoshop for facial feature scaling
tips.context: Better than trying to use DWPose for subtle facial adjustments

tips.tip: Use same rank for LightX2V LoRA on high and low samplers
tips.context: Don't waste storage on different ranks

tips.tip: More detailed prompts can help maintain likeness in character replacement
tips.context: Instead of just 'the man is speaking'

tips.tip: For OVI audio, use 20 steps instead of 10 for better audio quality
tips.context: 10 steps is risky for audio

tips.tip: Use bindweave with actual box mask instead of full frame
tips.context: Full mask gets washed out and motion suffers

tips.tip: Include trigger word in training captions for character LoRAs
tips.context: Needed for Wan Animate to recognize the person

tips.tip: Don't mention clothing in captions if you want person wearing training data clothes
tips.context: For character LoRA training

tips.tip: Use larger generation sizes for better realism
tips.context: Generation size is the single biggest factor for output quality, even makes motion better. Try 576x1024 or 720x1024 for 33 frames

tips.tip: Add second sampler with low denoise for realism
tips.context: Use low denoise around 0.2 with Wan 2.2 Low noise to help with plastic look

tips.tip: Use higher shift for I2V
tips.context: Guidelines for Wan i2v is shift 9. Lower shift tends to make things sharper, which can make things look less real

tips.tip: Include person description in prompts
tips.context: Using a super simple prompt rarely generates great outcome. Copy captions from training data and update what you want different

tips.tip: Avoid extremely detailed reference images
tips.context: Providing reference images with too much detail can contribute to artifacts. Qwen-generated reference images avoid this because they're soft and lack detail

tips.tip: Crop reference faces to be larger with less wasted space
tips.context: When using Wan Animate with small faces in reference images

tips.tip: Run face detailer workflow separately rather than in the node chain
tips.context: For improving small faces in generated videos

tips.tip: Try different reference images as some work better than others
tips.context: When struggling with likeness in Wan Animate

tips.tip: Use AI Toolkit for training Wan LoRAs with good likeness results
tips.context: For character training with Wan models

tips.tip: Fixed seed is useful for seeing what changing values actually does
tips.context: Using same starting point with different settings to understand parameter effects

tips.tip: Use separate background and person/item instead of inpainting for TTM
tips.context: Prevents double objects and artifacts when using cut and drag techniques

tips.tip: Be careful with steps when using distill LoRAs and low steps
tips.context: Not much room for error with these combinations in TTM

tips.tip: Change seeds to solve VACE workflow inconsistencies
tips.context: Random seed changes can solve inconsistencies with same prompt/image/parameters

tips.tip: Use 127 grey for inpainting masks with VACE
tips.context: Still the default mask value even with new VACE implementation

tips.tip: Reduce end step on TTM node to get more motion and follow prompts better
tips.context: When you want the model to have more freedom to generate motion and follow movement prompts like wing flapping

tips.tip: Use convert image to mask node with reference video for simple TTM usage
tips.context: For basic camera movement replication, just pass reference video through convert image to mask node and connect to TTM mask input

tips.tip: Mentioning specific car model in prompts helps with vehicle generation
tips.context: When generating car scenes, being specific about the car model improves results

tips.tip: Prompting really helps with camera movements in TTM
tips.context: Adding camera movement descriptions in prompts (like 'camera zoom') can help avoid unwanted effects like earth shaking

tips.tip: Always preview high noise render first
tips.context: If high noise doesn't look reasonable, adjust prompt and settings before rerun

tips.tip: No magical settings work for all scenarios
tips.context: It's a game of tinkering, need to adjust for each use case

tips.tip: Base animation should match prompt intentions
tips.context: If prompting camera movement, base reference animation should support that

tips.tip: Use LightX2V 1030 for high noise with I2V
tips.context: Might be better than old version for high noise part

tips.tip: Graphics and color in motion signal video should match prompt
tips.context: Visual consistency between input animation and desired output

tips.tip: Use detailed prompting with FFGO for better results
tips.context: More descriptive prompts help prevent drift and improve object consistency

tips.tip: Start FFGO prompts with specific trigger phrase
tips.context: Begin with 'ad23r2 the camera view suddenly changes.' followed by detailed description

tips.tip: Use white background for FFGO reference subjects
tips.context: Helps isolate references for better multi-subject generation

tips.tip: Use detailed burpee prompt for exercise animations
tips.context: For fitness/exercise video generation with FFGO

tips.tip: Close all other apps except ComfyUI for low VRAM setups
tips.context: When running on limited 32GB RAM systems

tips.tip: Start with low settings and gradually increase to find limits
tips.context: For users with limited hardware resources

tips.tip: Use last frame for video extension
tips.context: Take the last frame of a video and do img2vid for extension

tips.tip: Use overscan composition technique with TTM
tips.context: Animate everything in overscan frame then crop in post so characters can enter from off-screen

tips.tip: Reference frames help preserve character consistency
tips.context: Even if reference doesn't match motion sequence, wan 'remembers' character appearance from that frame

tips.tip: TTM works best with I2V models
tips.context: Using with T2V changes background too much

tips.tip: Prompting becomes more important with soft-looking subjects
