tips.context: When subject is soft, there's too much room for interpretation on low noise

tips.tip: For testing TTM workflow without TTM, plug encoded latent into first sampler instead of TTM node
tips.context: When wanting to quickly test v2v approach

tips.tip: Describing characters in prompt is important for reference consistency
tips.context: When using character references in video generation

tips.tip: Create first frame with character already placed in scene
tips.context: For better expression transfer and character consistency

tips.tip: Use Qwen Image Edit for placing characters in scenes
tips.context: Good for consistency and lighting adjustment

tips.tip: Second pass with T2V LOW model at low denoise (0.2) can fix shading issues
tips.context: When output has incorrect shading compared to source

tips.tip: Work backwards for shots where subject enters/exits frame
tips.context: Only works on simple shots, not multiple entries/exits

tips.tip: LightX2V usually goes last in LoRA chain
tips.context: Has more dramatic overall effect

tips.tip: Use 2.1 VACE then last few steps with 2.2 low noise if you have depth
tips.context: When you have depth control available

tips.tip: Use Qwen Edit workflow to create correct first frame with character placed in scene
tips.context: When animating characters to avoid disappointment with Wan's character interpretation

tips.tip: Turn up CLIP vision embed strength and lower pose control settings for better character consistency
tips.context: When trying to maintain character likeness in animations

tips.tip: Use character reference images for better stability in complex scenes
tips.context: When generating videos with multiple characters or complex movements

tips.tip: Set frame_window_size to frame_count or multiple to avoid hallucination
tips.context: When input video finishes but Wan continues generating

tips.tip: Use masks when upscaling to only sharpen desired areas
tips.context: To avoid tile upscalers injecting unnecessary detail in backgrounds

tips.tip: Use MOE as a restrainer with 480p LoRA
tips.context: Keeps motion aligned with prompt while staying more expressive than MOE alone, prevents quality loss and fading

tips.tip: Use depthmap as mask for selective processing
tips.context: More accurate than regular masks, can select focal point from depth map then create mask based on it

tips.tip: Stack multiple LoRAs for better control
tips.context: Can use MOE high noise at 1, Lightx2v 480p rank 256 at 3, and Wan 2.1 at 0.30 for controlled motion without fading

tips.tip: Test block swap settings systematically
tips.context: Set to 30, try target resolution, then reduce by 5 until OOM - previous value is your sweet spot

tips.tip: Read model documentation for memory fixes
tips.context: Solutions like triton cache clearing are documented in readmes but people don't read them

tips.tip: Use JSON structured prompting for more precise results
tips.context: Format prompts with clear subject, camera, composition sections for better control

tips.tip: Avoid denoise parameter, use direct step control instead
tips.context: Both native and wrapper - use KSamplerAdvanced or set steps/start_step/end_step directly

tips.tip: For VRAM optimization, keep as many blocks in VRAM as possible without exceeding limit
tips.context: More blocks in VRAM = faster inference, but don't go over your card's VRAM

tips.tip: Prompt VACE 2.2 like instructing a literal person who only watched YouTube/Netflix
tips.context: When using Fun Vace 2.2 model, be very explicit and descriptive

tips.tip: For object replacement without masking everything, use canny/depth controlnet with strength experimentation
tips.context: When you need many pixels to change but want to preserve motion physics

tips.tip: Use high/low noise split for better results
tips.context: For most camera movements, only need lora for high noise as low will pick up existing movement from high pass generation

tips.tip: Don't use Vace reference for style transfer
tips.context: Vace reference is for background, setting, or subjects - not a style-transfer model even if occasionally works

tips.tip: Use Phantom+Vace combination for character work
tips.context: When character reference doesn't exactly match first frame position, combine Phantom with Vace for better results

tips.tip: Skip HN stage when using Phantom
tips.context: Phantom only works with LN part, can skip HN stage completely or make HN output look close enough to target references

tips.tip: Use chunked rope and pytorch RMS norm instead of compile
tips.context: Reduces VRAM usage without the compilation overhead and instability

tips.tip: Train control lora for proper latent upscaling
tips.context: Instead of interpolating latents, train diffusion model to synthesize missing information

tips.tip: Include as much as possible in one compile graph
tips.context: Better than having multiple separate compiled sections

tips.tip: Use del, gc.collect(), and torch.cuda.empty_cache() together
tips.context: To actually flush tensors completely, though this slows things down if done every block

tips.tip: Use disable smart memory for heavy workloads
tips.context: Always offloads but slows down lightweight tasks

concepts.explanation: System that uses video as reference but still requires massive text prompts explaining exact actions
Mixture of Experts architecture with High/Low noise expert split in Wan 2.2
Memory management technique that depends on system configuration, affected by unmerged LoRA changes
Command line argument feature that prevents large models from being cached in RAM to help with memory usage
LoRA that reduces artifacting for extensions, specifically designed for 5 input frames, effects are subtle but game-changing
Video control system for inpainting that provides more consistent results than basic noise masking
Memory management technique where model parts are offloaded, LoRAs now obey block swap instead of being fully offloaded
Allows precise control over character movement paths, similar to spine bone animations
LoRAs with different ranks that cause recompilation issues with torch compile
ComfyUI's new JavaScript framework frontend overhaul, similar to React
Feature that uses reference video as control input similar to VACE but without controlnet preprocessing
Different LoRA variants for Wan 2.2, MPS marginally better for prompt adherence
LoRA system that can change without recompilation, but causes issues with full graph compilation
Previously always disabled compile as it wouldn't work with sage, but now possible to compile sage with latest version, though other graph breaks exist in native sampling
Lynx is a module for enhanced identity preservation that can be added to other workflows
Hard cut creates abrupt scene changes while scene transitions create smooth morphing between scenes
First-Last-Frame mode, affects how end frame is encoded in video generation
Architecture that supports temporal autoregression for long-duration video synthesis
Performance benefit when using fp16 precision for calculations
bf16 loses mantissa, fp16 loses exponent - casting between them loses data permanently
New distillation method used in LightX2V T2V Seko v2.0, different from self-forcing technique
Terms used somewhat interchangeably, but are different techniques. FastVideo model uses 'self forcing' in config name but 'dmd' in pipeline class
Clip vision embed padding done after encoding with zeros, not encoding empty images. Input references to image_1 and it's handled automatically
Must be 8x+1 format (like 81 frames)
Pre-scales input latents and balances brightness increase, no actual 'motion data' at that processing stage
Segment Concept - new segmentation model for better results
Frames must align with latent block structure for certain effects to work properly
G_scaled = I + (G - I - D) * M + D where M is motion_amplitude, I is initial image, G is gray latents, D is mean difference
Rule for placing intermediate keyframes - if first frame is at 1 and last at 81, mid frame should be at 17 (4 x 4 + 1)
New memory feature merged into ComfyUI core that some people have trouble with, can be disabled with --disable-pinned-memory
Facilitate generating longer videos in one execution but don't help with extending existing videos. Sometimes loosely used for WanAnimate and InfiniteTalk batch generation beyond 81 frames
Technique to modify 'looseness' of latents and control where scene transitions occur by scheduling which latent frames have motion applied
For Bindweave, need to pad noise channel with zeros to match concatenated reference latents, done per step and trimmed before scheduler
Marks original area white and padded area black when reference aspect doesn't match video aspect
Each window needs input image but you only have one clean input for whole process, leading to either never getting away from input or doing text2vid
Artifacts caused by mismatch between real encoded and generated latents. Generated latents are blurry and out of distribution for the decoder, causing speckle/grid artifacts
If a node references a model, it's cached in the node itself and cannot be freed by VRAM cleanup nodes
Technique like LightX (dmd2) that helps sharpen generated latents, similar to how GAN loss sharpens VAE or image upscaler outputs
Memory optimization technique that allows running larger models by swapping blocks between GPU and system memory
8-bit floating point quantization that reduces VRAM usage while maintaining quality

concepts.term: Face input disconnection in Wan Animate
concepts.explanation: Removing the face_images connection prevents the model from trying to force facial features onto non-human subjects
A technique for controlling object movement in videos using masked latent inpainting with timestep scheduling
Wan 2.2's MoE architecture allows motion control on high noise side while resolution happens on low noise side
TTM requires clean alpha channels without background remnants to avoid artifacts and ghosting
A technique that's essentially v2v + differential diffusion with proper masks, applied only for a few steps during sampling. Works particularly well with Wan 2.2
Adjusting shift values so the split step sigma equals i2v sigma boundary (0.900) for optimal scheduler performance
A technique for guided video-to-video generation using masks to define different noise levels to different areas
Coefficient for noise added/removed per step in SDE/ancestral samplers. 0.5 makes Euler = Euler_ancestral, 0.0 = baseline Euler. Max practically 1.0
Multi-stage sampling: first sampler (1 step high noise, cfg 3.5, no lora), second sampler (high noise, cfg 1, with lightx2v), third sampler (low noise with lora)
Autoregressive model architecture that can potentially do long generation, different training approach than standard models
LoRA technique for Wan 2.2 that enables multiple subject generation with camera view transitions
Sampler that effectively performs twice the computational steps, should be compared against other samplers at 2x step count
LoRA that makes I2V easier, requires trigger prompt 'ad23r2 the camera view suddenly changes.'
Uses mask video to know what object to animate, very flexible for 2.5D and 3D camera movement
Uses controlnet to animate reference image from input video, built on Wan 2.1
Garbage collection - automatic process that frees up memory by deleting unused objects
Motion guidance system for Wan models, like v2v but with masking. Injects motion signals to control character movement
Injects different values for empty frames instead of all black, like varying intensities of gray. One line of code that calculates difference from init image
Uses separate samplers for high and low noise with different LoRAs, switching at sigma 0.9
Generalization that transports between arbitrary distributions, predicts velocity (noise - data). Outperforms diffusion
Two models split by timestep - high noise for motion, low noise for visuals. Like MoE but experts are entire models
Reference frames must fit this rule - insert reference 4 times then starting image
14B active parameters in MoE setup, total 27B parameters but only 14B active at inference time
Node groups similar to Blender that keep workflows clean, can be unpacked and modified
X(frame window) - (x-1)(motion frames) = total frames - explains why Wan continues past input length
First removes character from scene, second places character with pose in scene
Caches that accumulate during model updates and recompilation, causing memory increases especially on Windows
Low-rank matrices dimensions - higher rank gives more capacity/freedom but costs more parameters and possible artifacts, lower rank is more constrained but faster/safer
Puts model parts into normal RAM and brings to VRAM only when needed - slower but allows more free VRAM for larger operations
When not using fp8 fast mode, fp8 models on non-fp8 cards store weights in fp8 but cast to fp16 for calculations, adding compute overhead
Nunchaku implementation with custom kernels for fast inference, despite name similarity to SVD
SteadyDancer's default method using 3 separate model calls per generation for better quality
Denoise parameter adjusts steps/start_step/end_step but in counterintuitive way, better to set steps directly
LLMs use thousands of axes to map concepts, structured prompts like JSON provide more precise navigation than loose text
New distillation method from Z-Image where CFG distillation is the primary driver of step distillation, not just a side effect
MoE architecture approach where separate models handle different noise levels during denoising, brings capability of larger models to consumer GPUs
Optimization that splits RoPE (rotary positional embeds) and FFN (feed forward) calculations into chunks, reducing peak VRAM usage below attention level
Cascade approach of taking small high-channel latents and upscaling to high resolution using diffusion model, like a diffusion model upscaler
Breaks in torch.compile graph that prevent intermediate tensors from being released, causing higher VRAM usage
PyTorch feature that allows uncompiled operations to be part of the compile graph without breaking it
Elements that get concatenated to the noise input, staying separate until patch embedding
